Chariot Group reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $8,524,000 for the latest year and $1,615,000 for the year- earlier period.

title: North, as the Trial Heats Up, Is Depicted as Liar or Patriot
description: The prosecution and defense in the trial of Oliver L. North today painted clashing views of him as a liar or a patriot who misled Congress to keep politicians from revealing secrets that would harm national security.

title: Seoul Seems Unruffled by Referendum Delay
description: A day after President Roh Tae Woo indefinitely postponed a referendum on his performance in office, Seoul's streets were oddly quiet today and opposition leaders seemed more relieved than angry.

title: The Etiquette of Fax Transmission
description: LET us pause in the day's occupation to consider some of the social issues related to facsimile (fax) technology.

title: London Issues a Report on Jan. 8 Jet Crash
description: Accident investigators said today that they found no evidence that the cockpit warning system of a British Midland passenger jet malfunctioned when the crew shut down the wrong engine shortly before it crashed Jan. 8, killing 47 people.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: INTERNATIONAL A3-14 El Salvador elected Alfredo Cristiani President, the major political parties declared, paving the way for him to succeed Jose Napoleon Duarte on June 1. Page A1

title: Manila Seeks Aid on Debt
description: The Philippines will seek a combination of new loans and debt reduction in talks next month in New York with commercial banks, the Finance Secretary, Vicente Jayme, said today.

title: Japanese Test Illustrates Big Lead in TV of Future
description: Next month, while Congress and the Pentagon are nudging American electronics makers toward a new generation of television technologies, Japan plans a quiet demonstration of how far ahead of other nations it is. It will begin the world's first daily broadcasts of high-definition television, which produces images as sharp and detailed as movie images.

title: Salomon-Kelly Joint Venture Agrees to Buy Envirodyne
description: Donald P. Kelly and the merchant banking unit of Salomon Brothers Inc. said today that they had agreed to acquire Envirodyne Industries for $40 a share, totaling about $836 million.

title: Trilogy Resources Corp reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Top Democrat Is in Chicago Supporting Daley
description: Ronald H. Brown, the national Democratic chairman, urged his party today to unite behind Richard M. Daley for next month's Chicago mayoral election.

title: Coho Resources Ltd reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included special gains of $1,636,000 for the latest year and $696,000 for the year-earlier period. The company said after preferred share dividends, there were no earnings applicable to common shares in either period. Year-ago figures have been restated. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Chemists Create a New State of Matter: One Molecule Inside Another
description: A TEAM of chemists has succeeded in imprisoning molecules within other molecules like ship models in bottles, and has thereby created a new state of matter.

title: 'Eastern Standard' Closing
description: ''Eastern Standard,'' a comedy by Richard Greenberg, will close after the evening performance on Saturday at the Golden Theater, 252 West 45th Street. Directed by Michael Engler, the play will have run for 20 previews and 92 regular performances on Broadway.

title: Top Anchor Shifts at CBS and NBC
description: Two of the most prominent women in television news changed networks yesterday. CBS announced it had signed Connie Chung, the NBC correspondent and weekend anchor, to a three-year contract, and NBC announced it had signed Mary Alice Williams, the prime-time co-anchor, vice president and New York bureau chief for the Cable News Network.

title: Review/Music; Rock's Cool Observer Turns Into a Chatterbox
description: Lou Reed, once as deadpan and taciturn as his music was ferocious, has reincarnated himself as a talkative avuncular elder statesman of rock.

title: HPSC Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Included a loss of $3,969,000 from an accounting change for both the quarter and year. c-Net income The latest quarter and year included losses of $15,588,000 and $17,100,000, respectively, from provisions due to an increase in the reserve for bad debts and writeoff of some leases. Year-ago quarter and year included losses of $1,358,000 and $2,108,000, respectively, from provisions for such items.

title: Bridge
description: Teams captained by Ron Rubin of Manhattan, and Eddie Kantar of Venice, Calif., clashed in the final of the Vanderbilt Knockout Team Championship here today after surviving the most exciting pair of semifinals within memory.

title: Bruncor Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: 2d Resignation At Kentucky
description: One day after Kentucky's head basketball coach, Eddie Sutton, resigned, an assistant involved in a controversy over a recruit has also left the school.

title: Baskin-Robbins Chief Foresees Few Changes
description: Baskin-Robbins Inc., one of the world's largest franchised ice cream operations, said yesterday that it had named a new president and chief executive, William I. Savel.

title: Curbs on Deadly Insecticide Are Urged
description: The Environmental Protection Agency's pesticide division has recommended barring the use of an acutely toxic insecticide on potatoes and imported bananas. The staff report says the chemical presents an unreasonable risk to infants and children.

title: Penwest Ltd reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: b-After net from discontinued operations of $2,622,000 for the quarter and $5,072,000 for the 6 months. c-After net from discontinued operations of $380,000 and $1,022,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively.

title: Cuomo Vetoes Death Penalty Seventh Time
description: Gov. Mario M. Cuomo vetoed legislation today that would have restored the death penalty in New York State, the seventh time he has done so in as many years. But this year, the Legislature appears to be closer than ever to overriding a veto.

title: Biotherapeutics Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: The latest quarter and 9 months included $3,530,000 in one-time special charges.

title: Coca Mines Inc reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: Latest year earnings included a gain on the sale of stock in equity Silver Mines Ltd. of $2,384,800, compared to a similar gain of $3,645,200 in 1987.

title: Milton B. Conford, Ex-Judge, Is Dead at 80
description: Milton Bernard Conford, a retired judge of the New Jersey Superior Court, died of heart disease yesterday at Mount Sinai Medical Center in Manhattan. He was 80 years old and lived in Elberon, N.J.

title: The New Face of the Right: Alfredo Cristiani
description: The Uruguayan comic Verdaquer explains his own success with a joke: ''To be a good comedian, you have to be charming, and I'm very charming. You have to have a sense of humor, and I have a wonderful sense of humor. You have to be audacious, and I'm extremely audacious. You have to be absolutely brilliant, and I'm extremely audacious.''

title: 2 Ulster Police Officers Are Slain
description: Two senior police officers were killed today while returning from a meeting with colleagues in the Irish Republic, the authorities said. The Irish Republican Army took responsibility.

title: Western Corporate Enterrises Inc reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: The company said there are no year-earlier comparable results because it began operations in April 1987. For the 8 months ended Dec. 31, 1987, net was $259,026, or 10 cents a share, on revenue of $3,380,488. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Ault Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 26
description: b-Net loss

title: 4 Jailed Blacks Flee to Embassy in Pretoria
description: Four black detainees on a hunger strike escaped today from a Johannesburg hospital, fled 38 miles to Pretoria and took refuge at the West German Embassy, officials said.

title: Roadway Motor Plazas reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: Both year-ago periods' results included $250,000 in non-recurring income from various transactions.

title: Philip Morris Notes
description: The Philip Morris Companies is offering $300 million of 10.85 percent notes due in September 1990 at a price of par through underwriters led by Morgan Stanley & Company. Noncallable for a year, the notes are priced to yield about 99 basis points more than Treasury securities with a similar maturity. Underwriters said the issue carries a Baa-1 rating from Moody's Investors Service and A by Standard & Poor's.

title: Private Investigator Intends To Testify He Was Framed
description: A private investigator who was accused by a Congressional subcommittee of saying falsely that he worked for the panel plans to testify today that he was framed by the aide who headed the inquiry, according to an outline of the investigator's testimony.

title: SPORTS PEOPLE: Basketball; Donoher Is Dismissed
description: Don Donoher, the winningest basketball coach in the University of Dayton's history, was dismissed yesterday. Donoher's 25-season record at Dayton was 437-275. In 1966-67, he guided the Flyers to the N.C.A.A. tournament final, where they were defeated by U.C.L.A. The Flyers were 12-17 this season.(AP)

title: Market Place; Stagflation Fears Rise on Wall St.
description: INFLATION is the fear du jour on Wall Street.

title: Supreme Court Ends Delay In Linking of Detroit Papers
description: The Supreme Court today cleared the way for a partial merger of Detroit's two daily newspapers under a 1970 law that permits an antitrust exemption for financially failing newspapers.

title: Skylink America Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net loss

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; D'Arcy Masius Sells Office to DDB Needham
description: D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles/ U.S.A. announced the sale yesterday of its San Francisco office to DDB Needham. No terms were disclosed, but people involved in the deal said it was a non-cash transaction that included DDB Needham's assumption of D.M.B.&B.'s lease, and potential payments to D.M.B.&B. based on the profitability of the two accounts DDB is picking up, the Idaho Potato Commission and Hyundai Electronics.

title: Unisys Offering
description: The Unisys Corporation is offering $100 million of 10.75 percent notes due on Sept. 28, 1990, at a price of 100 through a group of underwriters led by Merrill Lynch Capital Markets. Noncallable for one year, the notes were priced to yield about 95 basis points more than the two-year Treasury notes and are rated A-3 by Moody's Investors Service and A- by Standard & Poor's.

title: Car Industry Protests California Antipollution Plan
description: The American automotive industry must overcome vast technological hurdles and what it sees as an unreasonably tight timetable before it can provide vehicles that meet the air-quality standards imposed on Friday by regional officials in Southern California.

title: Patterns; Buying What People Wear
description: ''The runway and reality are poles apart,'' said Ann Keenes, a senior vice president of the Neiman-Marcus stores, as she was leaving one of the Paris ready-to-wear shows last week.

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: In the World of the Organized Jewish Community, Money Talks; Not Monolithic at All
description: To the Editor:

title: Dummerston Journal; A Plague in Vermont Clouds Sugaring Time
description: ''Is it running?''

title: Conflict at Sematech Forces Out No. 2 Man
description: The chief operating officer of Sematech, the semiconductor industry's fledgling research consortium, resigned abruptly today because of differences in management style with Robert N. Noyce, the chief executive.

title: SPORTS PEOPLE: Basketball; Tripucka Hospitalized
description: Kelly Tripucka, the leading scorer for the Charlotte Hornets with an average of 22.7 points a game, has been hospitalized in Oakland, Calif., with what is believed to be back spasms or a kidney stone. After experiencing a sharp pain in his middle back shortly before the Hornets were to leave their hotel for their game Sunday against the Golden State Warriors, Tripucka was taken by ambulance to Peralta Hospital. Back pain had prevented Tripucka from playing against Denver and Seattle last week, but he played for 27 minutes Friday against the Clippers, scoring 18 points. Tripucka was held overnight and yesterday was listed in good condition. (AP)

title: Transit Financial Holdings Inc reports earnings for
description: b-After a special gain of $84,000 for the quarter and a tax credit of $346,000 for the year. c-Net income Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Review/Theater; Plays Classic and Modern, Stripped to Bare Essentials
description: Voice, gesture and expression are about all Nick Ward allows the actors to use in two plays he is directing at the Harry De Jur Playhouse during the second American tour of the Education Department troupe of Britain's Royal National Theater. Some characters in ''Macbeth'' wield knives (not swords) in battle; in Mr. Ward's own play, ''Apart From George,'' two chairs, a walking stick, a bucket and a notebook are all the props. Four actors take on the five roles in Mr. Ward's play and eight actors perform 27 parts in the Shakespeare. Even the costumes in both plays seem little more than suggestions to stimulate the viewer's imagination.

title: Trans World Music Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 28
Southland Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included tax benefits of $50,085,000 for the quarter and $110,060,000 for the year, and equity of $29,063,000 and $70,841,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, in the earnings of Citgo Petroleum Corp. c-Included a tax benefit of $61,638,000 and equity of $6,997,000 in Citgo earnings. The 1987 full-year results are not comparable because of the effects of the leveraged buyout that took place during that year. The 1988 results excluded sales from 1,000 convenience stores and business units being divested.

title: Fletcher Leisure Group Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After special gains of $24,000 for the latest quarter and $35,000 for the year-earlier period. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Stripping America's Forests
description: President Bush could extend his promising environmental record by abandoning an ill-conceived scheme to speed the deforestation of the United States - already far advanced - for the benefit of Japan.

title: Three D Departments reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Nike Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
Safecard Services reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Emhart Plans Merger With Black & Decker
description: The Emhart Corporation, which has been resisting a $2.4 billion takeover attempt by a New York investment group, announced a merger agreement yesterday with the Black & Decker Corporation valued at $2.8 billion.

title: SPORTS PEOPLE: Basketball; Trenton Star Honored
description: Greg Grant of Trenton State College, whose 1,044 points this season set an N.C.A.A. Division III record, was named the Division III player of the year by the National Association of Basketball Coaches yesterday. Grant led Trenton State to a 30-2 record and the runner-up spot to Wittenberg University in the Division III championship competition. Grant, a 5-foot-7-inch, 140-pound senior guard, had 30 games this season in which he scored 20 points or more, and in 10 of those games, he scored 40 or more. His career average of 30.7 was a Division III record.

title: David Meiklejohn, 80, Financial Executive
description: David Shirra Meiklejohn, a retired financial executive, died of a heart attack Saturday at Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. He was 80 years old and lived in Greenwich.

title: Dow Slumps 29.64 More, To 2,262.50
description: Stock prices yesterday continued the sharp slide that began on Friday in reaction to the report of a larger-than-expected rise in producer prices.

title: Corrections
description: A report in the Patents column of Business Day on Saturday, about a new form of optical memory device, misidentified the inventor. He is Joseph Lindmayer.

title: Far West Industries reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Retirement Due At Chip Maker
description: James M. Smaha, the executive vice president and head of semiconductor operations for the National Semiconductor Corporation, will retire early, the company said today.

title: 4 Boeing Jetliners Ordered by Varig
description: The Boeing Company said that Varig, the Brazilian airline, had ordered four Boeing 767-300 extended-range jetliners valued at about $300 million. Boeing has had a rash of orders in the last 15 months, including a record 636 airplanes valued at $29.7 billion in 1988. So far this year it has announced orders for 67 airplanes valued at $6.3 billion, a company spokesman said.

title: GTS Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Chess
description: ''I believe that these girls are going to lose a good part of their quickly acquired image in the 28th Olympiad. Maybe now they can experience some surprises. Anyway, afterward we are going to know if the Hungarian sisters are geniuses or just women!'' This attempt to laugh off the prowess of the three marvelous Polgar sisters from Budapest came from the Soviet grandmaster and Soviet womens' team coach, Eduard Gufeld.

title: Honduras Bars Journalists From the Contras' Base Area
description: The Honduran Army barred journalists today from the border region where Nicaraguan rebel camps are situated after two soldiers were killed by mines in the area.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''It's a victory for the Salvadoran people.'' -Alfredo Cristiani, claiming victory in the presidential elections. [ A1:6. ]

title: Messinger Starts Drive to Become Borough Leader
description: Pledging a ''government of integrity, effectiveness and foresight,'' City Councilwoman Ruth W. Messinger yesterday announced her candidacy for Manhattan borough president.

title: Will the Banks Block Debt Relief?
description: LEAD: Thanks to a proposal put forth by the Treasury Secretary, Nicholas F. Brady, there is new hope that the debt crisis in developing countries can be successfully resolved. While the details have yet to be spelled out, the Brady initiative at least recognizes that the debt burden must be sharply reduced, with our commercial banks finally accepting losses on their bad loans.

title: UConn Tops California On George's Foul Shots
description: Tate George sank two free throws with five seconds left tonight to give the defending champion Huskies a 73-72 victory over California in the second round of the National Invitation Tournament.

title: Commercial Metals Co reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
Time Management Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Electrohome Ltd reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included a $400,000 loss from discontinued operations and a $4.7 million special gain. c-Net loss and included a $1.1 million loss from discontinued operations and a $400,000 special charge. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Plasti-Fab Ltd reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-After a gain of $404,000. c-Net income The company changed its year-end to Dec. 31 from Jan. 31 and the 1987 figures are for 11 months. The results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Enzo Biochem reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After an extraordinary gain of $420,000 from early retirement of debt. The company said in the latest quarter, it established a pretax charge against earnings of $418,000 as a result of the failure of Johnson & Johnson to make scheduled contract payments. The charge included legal fees and other litigation costs which have been incurred in legal proceedings filed against Johnson & Johnson. In the prior quarter, this pretax charge was $635,000. The charge for the latest first half was $1,138,000, compared to $1,325,000 for the prior first half.

title: Panhandle Eastern
description: The Panhandle Eastern Corporation, the Houston-based natural gas pipeline company, extended its $53-a-share cash tender offer for the Texas Eastern Corporation, also based in Houston, until midnight April 3. The offer, which began Feb. 21, had been set to expire at midnight today. Panhandle Eastern said that almost 13.5 million of the 48.7 million Texas Eastern shares included in its offer had been tendered as of the close of business today.

title: Merry-Go-Round Enterprises Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 28
Miami Pupils: Future Hope Is Crisis Now
description: With as many as 500 immigrant children streaming into this area each month - enough to fill one new school every eight weeks - the Dade County education system, the nation's fourth largest, has been thrown into crisis.

title: Business and Health; New Incentives To Take Care
description: DRIVE badly and pay more for automobile insurance; live badly but pay no more for health insurance. That remains the rule, even after recent studies showing that employees who smoke, or drink heavily, or ignore seat belts, or do not exercise or watch their weight often run up far higher medical bills than their more conscientious colleagues. But gradually, the number of exceptions to that rule is increasing.

title: Hatfield Gets a Close Look At the Capital Crime Wave
description: Senator Mark O. Hatfield witnessed a shooting last week but did not report the incident to the police, a television station reported today.

title: New Helicopter Deaths Spur Debate
description: The death of 19 marines in the crash of a helicopter in South Korea, together with a recent series of other crashes, has once again drawn attention to helicopter safety.

title: 1 in 5 School Districts Violate Asbestos Law
description: One in five school districts is violating a 1987 Federal requirement to inspect buildings for asbestos and develop a cleanup plan, the Environmental Protection Agency said today.

title: BRIEFS
description: * British Airways said one of its Concorde jets would make the first all-supersonic flight around the world beginning April 1. On its three-week trip, the plane could set more than a dozen world speed records.

title: Inquiry on School Corruption Quickens
description: Investigations into allegations of corruption in New York City's local school districts have reached an intensive phase involving a range of overt and covert operations, officials leading the inquiries say.

title: Soccer Ball Molecules
description: AS chemists hone techniques for synthesizing carbon-based ''prison'' molecules, research teams elsewhere have found evidence that analogous spheres of carbon atoms commonly form throughout the universe.

title: Electro-Sensors Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Latest quarter and year included a gain of $36,000 from an accounting change.

title: Commonwealth Edison reports earnings for 12mo Feb 28
He'll Be Delighted
description: Today, the Budget Director, Richard G. Darman, is scheduled to be the last Bush Administration official to appear before the House Banking Subcommittee on Financial Institutions to discuss the Bush bailout plan for savings and loans. Finally.

title: Amerihealth Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a charge of $111,000 from the reversal of tax loss carryforwards for the quarter and tax credits of $267,000 for the year. c-Included a charge of $247,000 from the reversal of tax loss carryforwards. d-Net loss The company said the latest year share earnings was less than one cent a share after preferred dividend requirements.

title: Atlantic American Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After an extraordinary gain of $2,811,000 from repurchase of long- term debt for both the quarter and year. The 1988 loss resulted primarily from the amortization of deferred acquisition costs of $41 million, principally due to abnormally high lapse rates caused by uncertainty regarding the new medicare catastrophic coverage act, rate increases and increased competition.

title: Review/Guitar; Adding to Flamenco's Form
description: The Spanish classical guitarist Andres Segovia used to complain that true flamenco had become debased and commercialized during the 20th century, and that in its pure form, the style was dead. Younger flamenco players have refused to accept that verdict, and in recent years, several have devoted themselves to reviving and extending the style's traditional repertory.

title: Noboru Gotoh, Japanese Businessman, 72
description: Noboru Gotoh, a leader of one of Japan's largest business conglomerates and former president of the Japan Chamber of Commerce and Industry, died of respiratory failure today. He was 72 years old.

title: Rise in Poison Deaths
description: Poisoning deaths are on the rise in this country, largely because of a growing number of accidental drug poisonings, the Centers for Disease Control reports. Many of the cases involved overdoses of illegal drugs.

title: 'Under Milk Wood'
description: The Dylan Thomas Society of Great Britain will present ''Under Milk Wood'' at the Triplex Theater, 199 Chambers Street, at 7:30 P.M. March 30. The production celebrates the 75th anniversary of the poet's birth in Swansea, Wales, where the society is based. Tickets are $18; $15 for students. Information: 618-1980.

title: HDTV Plea On Soviets
description: A House subcommittee asked the Commerce Department yesterday to determine whether a planned demonstration of high-definition television equipment in the Soviet Union would result in the transfer of sensitive technology.

title: Original-Instruments Orchestra Set for New York
description: A New York City orchestra that will play the Classical symphonic repertory on original instruments has taken two major steps from the realm of long discussions into the world of practicality.

title: The Middle East Lie
description: The only thing new in the world is the history you don't know. Harry Truman said that. Yes, and the most dangerous thing in the world is the history we do know but pretend never happened. That is when people and nations squirm and twist and finally act in duplicity. Trying to escape the truth of the past creates a new episode in history, usually sadder than it might have been.

title: U.S. Lawsuits Settled by G.E.
description: The Justice Department said today that the General Electric Company had agreed to pay $3.5 million to settle four Federal lawsuits contending that the company had defrauded the Government on military contracts.

title: Libraries Have to Grow, Not Just Keep Up
description: To the Editor:

title: Torotel Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After extraordinary gains of $38,000 for the quarter and $94,000 for the 9 months. c-After income from discontinued operations of $76,000 and an extraordinary gain of $90,000.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Networks vs. Cable: Battle Heating Up
description: FACED with network television's first sustained attack against its effectiveness, cable television is responding with outwardly conciliatory tones, hoping to demonstrate that all television programmers share common ground when advertisers are casting a wary eye on their budgets. Yesterday, Robert H. Alter, the president of the Cabletelevision Advertising Bureau, even conceded, ''There is a lot positive to be said of network television.''

title: Huge Drifting Nets Raise Fears for an Ocean's Fish
description: DEPLOYING huge nets, each twice as long as Manhattan, hundreds of fishing vessels from three Asian nations are plying the North Pacific with consequences that are unmeasured but potentially devastating for the ocean's ecology, United States officials and scientists say.

title: Breakup of Eastern Won't Hurt Air Competition; Ripoff of Assets
description: To the Editor:

title: Federal Express Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: b-Included a gain of $18,100,000 from an accounting change.

title: MacAndrews To Acquire Coleman
description: The Coleman Company, a maker of lanterns and camping equipment, agreed yesterday to be acquired by MacAndrews & Forbes Holdings Inc., which is controlled by Ronald O. Perelman, for $74 a share, or $545 million.

title: National HMO Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Everest & Jennings International Ltd reports earnings for 14wks to Dec 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $509,000 and $160,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,047,000 for the quarter and $2,001,000 for the year, and a gain of $1,750,000 from an accounting change for both the quarter and year. Prior year net from continuing operations included a gain of $289,000 from the sale of real estate.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Centurion Gold Ltd., Toronto, a mining company, named John Chapman president. He succeeds David Reesor, who has resigned.

title: Ripken Will Remain At Shortstop for Orioles
description: The Baltimore Orioles yesterday sent the rookie shortstop Juan Bell to their Rochester farm team, clearing the way for Cal Ripken Jr. to move back to his old position after playing at third base. Ripken is a six-time All-Star at shortstop. Craig Worthington, the International League's most valuable player last season, is expected to take over at third base. ''I'd always said I would play wherever they wanted me to,'' Ripken said. ''I just wanted to know where I would be. I've also got seven years of my career invested at shortstop.'' Bell, the younger brother of Toronto's George Bell, made six errors in 14 games at shortstop in spring training.(AP)

title: A.T.&T. Chairman Sees No Price War
description: Robert E. Allen, chairman of the American Telephone and Telegraph Company, said he does not plan to start a long-distance price war, despite a Federal ruling giving the company more flexibility in setting rates. Speaking at a news conference, Mr. Allen also said he does not think the company would be fully deregulated soon, despite predictions by analysts.

title: From Paris, Tiny Skirts or Covered Legs
description: At the Chanel collection that opened the second week of fall and winter showings here, the first model, Ines de la Fressange, stepped out on the runway to thunderous applause. She wore a typical navy Chanel suit buttoned in gold and piped in red and white. Only a few inches of red skirt showed below the hip-length jacket.

title: Americana Hotels & Realty Corp reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included a $5,895,000 gain from the sale of a property under a plan of liquidation.

title: Telephone & Data Systems Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $105,000 for the quarter and a gain of $731,000 for the year, both from discontinued operations. c-After gains from discontinued operations of $285,000 for the quarter and $1,182,000 for the year. The year-ago per share figures have been adjusted to reflect 3-for-2 stock splits paid in March 1988 and December 1988.

title: How to Say a Lot in a Hurry
description: PRODUCTIVITY Plus, reviewed here last year, is a handy program that can considerably improve both the speed and accuracy of anyone who does a lot of typing. With PRD+ in memory, you type an abbreviation, ''ASAP,'' for example, and your computer expands it to ''as soon as possible.''

title: Burke's Lively Goaltending Keeps Devils' Hopes Alive
description: Sean Burke and his defensemen had performances tonight that were reminiscent of the Devils' drive to the playoffs last spring. Burke was spectacular and the defensemen were steady in a 3-1 triumph over the Vancouver Canucks at Byrne Meadowlands Arena.

title: Beating Death at Jail Prompts U.S. Inquiry
description: The Justice Department is looking into allegations of criminal civil rights violations at the Hudson County Jail here after the recent beating death of a 27-year-old inmate and the arrest of three corrections officers, the United States Attorney for New Jersey, Samuel A. Alito, said today.

title: Baltimore Gas & Electric reports earnings for 12mo Feb 28
Emigres Deluge New York Agencies
description: Faced with a deluge of Soviet Jewish emigres arriving in New York City, social-service agencies are struggling to keep up, expanding their resettlement services and seeking new sources of money.

title: Richard Barr, a Figure in Theater, Is Recalled at a Sardi's Gathering
description: Richard Barr, the longtime president of the League of American Theaters and Producers who died on Jan. 9 at the age of 71, was remembered last night during a tribute at Sardi's restaurant on West 44th Street.

title: Summagraphics Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 29
Cancapital Corp reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included a special gain of $5.4 million. The company said 1987 revenue included $29.1 million from the sale of its interest in Poco Petroleums Ltd. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Bomb-Like 'Gift' for Gotti Is Found in Little Italy
description: The police found what appeared to be a crude bomb outside a Little Italy social club yesterday after an anonymous caller had told them ''a gift for John Gotti'' had been left there. But an inspection found the charge in the bomb to be mostly salt, making it unlikely that it would have exploded.

title: Del Monte Studied By RJR Nabisco
description: RJR Nabisco Inc. said it had retained an investment banking firm to study the possible sale of Del Monte and consider other options, but it has not yet decided whether to sell the food subsidiary. The company made the statement after The Wall Street Journal reported today that Kohlberg, Kravis, Roberts & Company, which bought RJR for a record $24.53 billion in February, had assigned Goldman, Sachs & Company to seek bids for Del Monte.

title: Review/Television; Hunting the Vast Oil Supply That Experts Say Is Waiting
description: Once past the hyperbolic title, ''The World Is Full of Oil'' is full of information on how geologists are going about trying to get at what they believe may be vast untouched deposits of the fuel. Tonight's edition of ''Nova,'' at 8 o'clock on Channels 13 and 49 and at 9 on Channel 21, takes us on explorations from Wyoming to Zambia, from Texas to Sweden, with mixed results. The goal is to replenish the world's fast-diminishing reserves outside the unpredictable Middle East.

title: Deregulation Is Urged
description: The Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development today called on industrialized countries to deregulate their economies further. In a new study, the O.E.C.D., which consists of the 24 leading free-market economic powers, said industrialized nations had room to dismantle rigidities in their labor and financial markets, their industrial structures and their public sectors.

title: Drug Labs Seized in Undercover Operation
description: About 70 people accused of making illegal drugs were arrested Sunday and seven methamphetamine laboratories were seized by state and Federal agents at the end of a three-year undercover operation, officials said today.

title: Cuomo Shifts Stance on Blocking State University Tuition Increase
description: Gov. Mario M. Cuomo, who had in recent weeks vowed to block any attempt by the State University to raise tuition, said today that he might not stand in the way after all.

title: Satellite Music Network Inc reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: News Report Stirs Dispute
description: Hemodynamics Inc., a Florida medical concern, has disclosed that a court has granted its request for a preliminary injunction against its former public relations concern.

title: Riverbend International reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After a gain of $226,000 from the cumulative effect of an accounting change.

title: Informality Reigns
description: The formal, evening news conferences that came to be President Ronald Reagan's principal connection to the press and the voters, infrequent as they were, are becoming even more of a dinosaur in the Bush Administration. There are a couple of reasons President Bush has no plans for such an event, White House officials say. First, he is much more comfortable with the bantering at informal gatherings of reporters than he is with the ritual of the structured event. Furthermore, these officials say, he has polled White House reporters informally and found none in favor of the nighttime events.

title: Reviews/Film Festival; When Despair Ruins Hope for a New Life
description: Agliberto Melendez's murky thriller, ''A One-Way Ticket,'' is likely to give the shivers to anyone with tendencies toward claustrophobia. Based on an incident that took place in 1981, the film tells the story of a group of Dominicans who bribe dock officials in Santo Domingo to smuggle them aboard a ship bound for Miami.

title: Campaign Notes; Mayoral Perks: Political Sweep for Mr. Ed?
description: About 150 of New York City's 350 mechanical brooms are known within the Sanitation Department as Mr. Ed and with good reason. They are equipped with a recorded message from Mayor Edward I. Koch for motorists blocking the sweeping operation. ''This is Ed Koch, your Mayor; you know the Sanitation Department can't sweep this street if you don't move your illegally parked car. Puh-leez get it out of here'' goes the message in the inimitable Koch voice.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Cigarette Advertising Attacked on New Front
description: A prominent Congressional foe of smoking opened another front yesterday in his battle against cigarette advertising. Representative Thomas A. Luken, Democrat of Ohio, asked Attorney General Dick Thornburgh to investigate whether two cigarette manufacturers violated Federal law by paying to have their products featured in films.

title: New York Tax On Limos Stirs Jersey Protests
description: New York City's new $250 tax on out-of-town limousines has prompted more anti-New York grumbling from some politicians running for governor in New Jersey.

title: Devaluation in Hungary
description: The National Bank of Hungary said today that it would devalue the forint by an average of 5 percent against convertible currencies, effective on Tuesday. The move will help to increase exports and ease demand for hard currency, which is growing because of import liberalization, the bank said in a statement reported by the Hungarian press agency M.T.I.-Econews. The last devaluation, of 6 percent, was in July 1988.

title: Great Atlantic & Pacific Tea Co reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 25
SALVADOR RIGHTIST WINS PRESIDENCY, BIG PARTIES AGREE
description: The major political parties today declared Alfredo Cristiani of the rightist Nationalist Republican Alliance the winner of the Salvadoran election, paving the way for him to succeed Jose Napoleon Duarte as president on June 1.

title: Henry G. Hay, Executive, 68
description: Henry G. Hay, a former vice president of Eastern Airlines, died of cancer Tuesday at his home in Hobe Sound, Fla. He was 68 years old.

title: Agent's Injury Delays Trial
description: The trial of the sports agents Norby Walters and Lloyd Bloom was put off for the day when Walters was injured this morning on his way to court.

title: Terrorism Alert: A System Shows Gaps
description: The furor over whether the British authorities failed to pass along warnings about a new kind of terrorist bomb in time to prevent the destruction of a Pan Am jumbo jet has revealed a serious lack of coordination between governments and airlines on terrorism, diplomats and officials here say.

title: No Blank Check for El Salvador
description: El Salvador's Arena party wants Washington to believe that its presidential candidate, Alfredo Cristiani, the declared winner of Sunday's election, leads a newly moderate cause. That warrants skepticism; the party was founded by former Maj. Roberto D'Aubuisson, long linked to notorious death squads. But there's no need for the United States to speculate. The character of a Cristiani government will be clear soon enough. If political savagery unfolds, the United States will almost certainly cut aid.

title: Shield Law Bill Advances
description: The law that protects New York journalists from being forced to reveal sources or produce notes and film in court would be strengthened under a bill approved today by the State Assembly. The proposal would extend the state's Shield Law protection to include non-confidential information - the notes, photos and video footage gathered by reporters without any promise of confidentiality. The Assembly approved the measure 131 to 4.

title: An Enigma In the Sky Has Taken New Twist
description: THE mystery involving an object that astronomers believe was ejected by a supernova has taken another twist.

title: Trump Balking On Shuttle
description: Donald J. Trump said yesterday that he had asked Frank Lorenzo, the chairman of the Texas Air Corporation, to reduce sharply the price of the Eastern Airlines shuttle, which Mr. Trump agreed in October to buy for $365 million.

title: N.F.L. Minor League A Possibility for 1990
description: The National Football League already plays exhibition games in Europe, its merchandise is bought there with fervor and if Commissioner Pete Rozelle has his way, by the spring of 1990 the league will have a minor league football operation based in Europe.

title: Claire's Stores Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Included a gain from the cumulative effect of an accounting change of $530,000.

title: Organic Produce Preferred
description: An large majority of Americans say they would buy organically grown food if it cost the same as fruits and vegetables grown with synthetic fertilizers or pesticides, and nearly half say they would pay more, according to a survey released Sunday.

title: Q&A
description: Star Distances Q.How do we know how far away the stars are? A.''This is something that takes up weeks in an introductory astronomy class,'' said Andrew Fraknoi, an astronomer, who is the executive officer of the Astronomical Society of the Pacific. However, he said, modern measurements depend on a relatively simple initial principal.

title: Careers; Managerial Prestige and Bankruptcy
description: FOR security analysts, management recruiters and managers worried about top-level jobs, Richard A. D'Aveni of Dartmouth's graduate business school has an interesting suggestion: Learn about and watch more closely the top managements of financially troubled companies.

title: Intriquing Studies Link Nutrition to Immunity
description: RESEARCHERS studying the often-surprising effects of nutrition on immunity report that dietary manipulation can become a promising new tool to foster recovery or prevent disease in millions of people.

title: More Organs Being Donated By Survivors for Transplant
description: More Americans are offering dead relatives' organs for transplant, a national transplant network reported today.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an obituary on March 11 about Kermit Beahan, bombardier on the World War II airplane that bombed Nagasaki, Japan, misidentified the plane. It was called Bock's Car, not the Great Artiste.

title: Reviews/Film Festival; Hungarian Family Life Amid the Soviet Invasion
description: Peter Gardos's ''Whooping Cough'' manages to make the 1956 Hungarian uprising and the subsequent Soviet invasion look as commonplace as a situation comedy spiced up with a little situation drama, not because the subject is small but because the sensibility that shaped the film is dull.

title: Strong Quake in Alaska
description: An earthquake capable of doing considerable damage was felt in central Alaska Sunday but no injuries or damage were reported. The tremor, at 4:07 P.M., was centered 170 miles southwest of Anchorage, said Don Finley, a spokesman for the United States Geological Survey in Washington. Geological Survey monitors in Golden, Colo., recorded the quake at 5.3 on the Richter scale of ground motion.

title: Suit Says Boetsky Had Cash in '86
description: When Ivan F. Boesky agreed to pay $100 million to settle civil insider trading charges in 1986, and a year later, when he was sentenced to three years in prison for filing false information with the Government, he and his lawyers said he was nearly bankrupt.

title: Nuclear Site Faces New Obstacles
description: Five environmental groups have raised new legal objections that could further delay the opening of a new nuclear waste repository near Carlsbad, N.M., that is an important link in the nation's bomb-making complex.

title: All American Semiconductor reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: The company said results do not reflect a 25 percent stock dividend paid March 13.

title: Kurzweil Music Systems Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income c-Net loss The company said the latest year's net was exceeded by preferred stock dividends.

title: Rangers' Skid Is Slowed
description: It might have been a laugher if the Rangers had not been hurting so much. So in the locker room afterward, they managed just smiles: small, perfunctory smiles born more of relief than confidence.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Accounts
description: * Mr. Goodbuys, a department store chain, to Chiat/Day, New York, for its television advertising, with a budget of $2 million.

title: 20 Die as Israelis Bomb Lebanon
description: Israeli Air Force planes today bombed the main base in Lebanon of a Palestinian guerrilla group linked to recent attempts to infiltrate Israel. Twenty people were killed and dozens were wounded as three buildings were leveled in the raid, the police and Palestinians said.

title: Odd Book Deal for Gingrich
description: Representative Newt Gingrich, who initiated the ethics investigation of House Speaker Jim Wright by complaining about issues that included an advantageous book deal for the Speaker, had an unusual book-selling arrangement himself.

title: Bush Considers Calling in Guard To Fight Drug Violence in Capital
description: President Bush is considering stern measures to curb the drug-related violence in Washington, including tougher gun control and the possible use of Federal troops, a variety of Administration officials said.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Schmertz/Hilton Formed
description: Two prominent public relations executives have joined forces to create an agency devoted to advocacy and issue advertising. Herbert Schmertz, who was vice president of public affairs at the Mobil Corporation, and Jack Hilton, who headed the telecommunications division of J. Walter Thompson, will merge their communications companies to form Schmertz/Hilton. The firm will also handle some corporate advertising.

title: Building From the Ground Up; Falwell Sees Liberty as an Athletic Powerhouse
description: Robert E. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia strove mightily to reach this mountain city in central Virginia in hopes of keeping the Confederate cause alive. But the retreat failed, and Lee's troops surrendered to Ulysses S. Grant's Union forces at nearby Appomattox Court House April 9, 1865.

title: By Design; In the Cafes, the Look Is Short
description: The most popular expression here of the continuing popularity of short skirts are the versions one sees everywhere in the streets and cafes. These are not skirts, in fact, but hip-length, fitted jackets with slightly flaring hems worn over opaque, skintight pantyhose or leggings and accompanied by flat-heeled, sturdy shoes.

title: Elf Aquitaine To Acquire Pennwalt
description: Elf Aquitaine, the French oil and chemicals giant, said yesterday that it had agreed to acquire the Pennwalt Corporation for nearly $1.1 billion, rescuing the company from a hostile takeover attack by a group of American businessmen.

title: KRG Management Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Texas Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: b-Net income c-After a gain of $6,599,000 from an accounting change.

title: Corrections
description: An article and a picture caption yesterday about candidates for the post of chairman of the National Endowment for the Arts referred incorrectly to a candidate, Barnabas McHenry. He resigned as general counsel to Reader's Digest in October 1985.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Ogilvy to Sell Subsidiary
description: In a move to focus on its core business, Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide said yesterday it would sell a drug communications subsidiary to the Nelson Companies, a medical marketing group. The subsidiary, Rolf Werner Rosenthal Inc., produces prescription drug advertising and a variety of medical literature. Billings in 1988 were $60 million. The terms of the deal were not disclosed.

title: U.S. Rig Count Declines
description: The number of working rotary oil-drilling rigs in the United States fell by three, to 740, in the week ended Friday, Baker Hughes Inc. said today. There were 943 rigs working a year earlier. The rig counts show the number of rigs actively exploring for oil, not the number producing oil.

title: Ethics, Reporters and The New Yorker
description: Janet Malcolm, a staff writer for The New Yorker, returned her magazine to the center of the long-running debate over ethics in journalism this month with her two-part article about the relationship between a murderer and an author who wrote about his crime.

title: Tri-R Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income

title: Westchester Orders Curbs On Water Use
description: Westchester County today imposed mandatory restrictions on water use under a drought emergency declared last week by Gov. Mario M. Cuomo.

title: Jayark Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Humana Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: In the year-ago 6 months period, the earnings included an extraordinary loss of $16,133,000 for early extinguishment of debt offset by a gain of $16,214,000 from an accounting change.

title: Warner Computer Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After a gain of $500,000 from a change in accounting.

title: Prices of Treasuries Sag Further
description: With worries about rising inflation continuing to plague participants in the credit markets, prices of Treasury notes and bonds sagged further yesterday as interest rates on short-term Treasury bills surged.

title: At Least 50 Are Slain in Sri Lanka Violence
description: At least 50 people were killed in Sri Lanka on Sunday in one of the worst days of political violence in the Indian Ocean nation, military officials said.

title: Smith Leaving Auburn
description: Sonny Smith, basketball coach at Auburn, whose team had a 9-19 record this season after having made trips to the National Collegiate Athletic Association tournament the previous five years, yesterday accepted the coaching job at Virginia Commonwealth. ''What I hope is that people won't remember me for the last season,'' Smith told The Montgomery Advertiser. ''I think Auburn needs new blood. They need new direction, a new style, a new type of excitement.'' He added: ''I'd still be here if we'd recruited worth a nickel. I told the staff to get four players or I was leaving. We didn't get them.'' Mike Pollio resigned as the Virginia Commonwealth coach at the end of this season after coaching the Sun Belt Conference team to a 13-15 record.

title: Comdata Holdings reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included tax credits of $838,000 and $1,083,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Included a tax credit of $2,966,000. The company said the latest quarter and year both included $2,344,000 in restructuring and other charges, compared with $4,802,000 for the year-ago quarter. The 1987 full-year results are not comparable because of the September 1987 leveraged buyout.

title: OPEC Supply Below Quota
description: The crude oil supply by 12 of the 13 OPEC members was below their combined quota ceiling in February, the Middle East Economic Survey said today.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; People
description: * Craig Walker has been named creative director of Krupp/Taylor USA, a subsidiary of Foote, Cone & Belding Communication Co.

title: Chicago Dock & Canal Trust reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income

title: Girlfriend Offers Hotel Alibi For Suspect in Officer Killing
description: The girlfriend of one of four men accused of murdering a police officer in Queens testified yesterday that the man was with her at a hotel when the officer was slain two miles away.

title: Toys 'R' Us in Manhattan
description: Toys ''R'' Us has signed a letter of intent to open its first Manhattan store, which will be in Herald Center, the vertical shopping mall at 34th Street and Broadway.

title: Books of The Times; An Unrepentant Traitor's Last Words
description: The Master Spy The Story of Kim Philby By Phillip Knightley Illustrated. 292 pages. Alfred A. Knopf. $19.95.

title: Yankees Had The Slugger Needed Now
description: rrNow that Dave Winfield might require disk surgery on his aching back, the Yankees need another slugger. Even after the acquisition of Mel Hall, the Yankees' general manager, Bob Quinn, is searching for a right-handed hitter with a big bat. Somebody like Jack Clark would be ideal.

title: Newcor Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
N.C.A.A. Tourney Gets Serious
description: Ever since it expanded to a 64-team format, the National Collegiate Athletic Association basketball tournament has taken on a carnival atmosphere in the first two rounds.

title: Macy's Profits Are Up 19.7%
description: R. H. Macy & Company posted a 19.7 percent earnings gain for the second quarter, ended Jan. 28. Profits totaled $72.6 million, or $7.93 a share, compared with $60.6 million, or $6.58 a share, in the corresponding quarter the year before.

title: Frequency Electronics reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: The company recognized a reduction in profits of about $1.5 million during the period.

title: Obstacle to Seabrook Lifted
description: The builders of the Seabrook nuclear plant said yesterday that they had removed the last obstacle to a low-power license for the plant by reaching agreement with an insurance company to provide money to decommission the reactor if it fails to operate above low power.

title: Nytest Environmental Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Ueberroth Confirms Inquiry On Rose
description: Major league baseball acknowledged today that it has been investigating ''serious allegations'' involving Pete Rose, the Cincinnati Reds' manager, who was linked to gambling activities last month.

title: As Brazil Vote Approaches, Magic of Democracy Wanes
description: Five years ago this month, as Brazilians by the millions marched, shouted and danced in favor of direct presidential elections, democracy was proclaimed to be the cure for all the ills bequeathed by the departing military regime.

title: Reco International reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,308,000 for the quarter and $1,314,000 for the 9 months. c-Net income and after losses of $105,000 for the quarter and $19,000 for the 9 months, both from discontinued operations.

title: West Europeans to Let Envoys Return to Iran
description: European Community foreign ministers agreed today that that ambassadors recalled from Iran over the Salman Rushdie affair were free to return if their governments wished to send them, diplomats said.

title: Texscan Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Board Returns Apples To New York Schools
description: Apples will be returned to New York City's public school menus next month, Board of Education officials said yesterday.

title: Soviet Poets Are Heard in Philadelphia
description: Yunna Morits was born in 1937, during the peak of Stalin's terror. As a young poet, she was praised by Anna Akhmatova, a badge of mythic proportions for any Russian writer. She earned another badge when she was accused of ''unhealthy tendencies'' and was not published in the Soviet Union for nine years.

title: Maine Inspired by Center's Return
description: Driven by an ambitious coach and inspired by intense public support, the University of Maine hockey team has its eye on a national championship. The pursuit begins at home Friday night in Orono against Providence College in the first quarterfinal game of the National Collegiate Athletic Association's Division I tournament.

title: Venezuela Bars Oil as Collateral
description: Venezuela's talks with banks on a $600 million bridge loan have stalled, the nation says, because it refuses to use oil as collateral.

title: CHINA AGAIN MOVES CENTRAL PLANNING TO CENTER STAGE
description: Cautioning that China had tried to change its economy too quickly in recent years, Prime Minister Li Peng called on China today to increase its reliance on central planning rather than market economics.

title: Richton International reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
The Editorial Notebook; The Librarian Priest
description: The recent appointment of the Rev. Timothy Healy as the new president of the New York Public Library provoked surprisingly little public comment or concern. While a few newspaper columns and letter writers raised questions, no one else doubted the appropriateness of a Roman Catholic priest's heading an institution in which the public has so large a stake.

title: Archie Bleyer, 79, Musical Director, Dies
description: Archie Bleyer, a musical director and arranger whose Cadence Records company provided a showcase for singers like Andy Williams, the Everly Brothers and the Chordettes, a 1950's-era quartet, died today at a rest home in Sheboygan, Wis. He was 79 years old.

title: Paris Journal; When Europe's Walls Tumble, Who'll Rush In?
description: Could the European Community's celebrated quest for a single market of 320 million consumers usher in a dog-eat-dog Darwinian nightmare in which workers' rights are trampled while Japanese and American multinationals run away with the biggest share of the business?

title: Munsingwear Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 7
Manatron Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Thoratec Laboratories reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: The latest year included a gain of $680,000 from the restructuring of debt. The prior year revenue included $650,000 from the sale of a patent.

title: Deere Sets Issue Of $150 Million
description: The John Deere Capital Corporation is offering $150 million of notes due in 1990 through underwriters led by Merrill Lynch Capital Markets.

title: Chemical Leaman Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a charge of $1,472,347 from an accounting change. c-Net loss

title: Oh, Nyet!
description: Next time, get a proofreader who speaks Russian.

title: I.M.F. Wary But Positive On Debt Plan
description: Michel Camdessus, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, gave a wary official welcome today to Treasury Secretary Nicholas F. Brady's proposals for reducing third-world debt, and he sketched a rough outline for I.M.F. participation.

title: Seligman & Associates reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net loss

title: George Mahoney, 87, Maryland Candidate
description: George Perry Mahoney, a Baltimore contractor who was a frequent unsuccessful political candidate, died Saturday night at his residence in a Baltimore hotel, He was 87 years old.

title: The U.N. Today
description: General Assembly COMMITTEE ON THE PEACEFUL USES OF OUTER SPACE, LEGAL SUBCOMMITTEE - 10 A.M. and 3 P.M. HUMAN RIGHTS COMMITTEE - 10 A.M. and 3 P.M. SPECIAL COMMITTEE AGAINST APARTHEID - 10:45 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Corrections
description: The Sky Watch chart with the Weather Report on Sunday misstated the beginning of spring. Spring began yesterday at 10:28 A.M.

title: Kings Road Entertainment reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
Cooper Cos reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After a $2,726,000 loss from discontinued operations and a $3,146,000 tax credit. The latest quarter included $3,828,000 realization of a loss on the planned divestiture of Cooper Technicon and a $13,515,000 gain on the sale of businesses. Year-ago quarter included a $9,000,000 loss on the sales of businesses.

title: On Horse Racing; Latest Entry in Speed Ratings
description: rrSpeed handicappers are those students of racing who believe that horses' running times can be modified and calibrated to answer the underlying question of every horse race: Who will get from point A to point B first?

title: Nunn Bipartisan Image Fades in Tower Fight
description: After the raw morality play around the nomination of John G. Tower as Secretary of Defense, Senator Sam Nunn of Georgia seems eager to slip back to the tidy esoterica of missile throw weights.

title: Injunction Set On Polaroid
description: A Delaware judge today granted an injunction sought by Shamrock Holdings Inc. to keep the Polaroid Corporation from completing its share-repurchase program, a central element in the instant camera company's fight against a Shamrock takeover.

title:
BUSINESS PEOPLE;
New Interco President Looks Down the Road
description: LEAD: Interco Inc. today appointed Richard B. Loynd as its next president and chief operating officer, succeeding Harry M. Krogh, who retires at the end of the month. Mr. Krogh, who is 59, will continue as a consultant to the company.

title: Luxtec Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net income and included a tax credit of $22,209. Year-ago share earnings were less than one cent a share.

title: Top City Seniors to Meet
description: A team of seniors from the Catholic High Schools Athletic Association will take on their counterparts from the Public Schools Athletic League at the Felt Forum tonight in the Senior Classic.

title: Twin Richfield Oils Ltd reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-After writedowns of U.S. oil and gas assets of $830,000 for the latest year and $2,401,000 for 1987. The results are in Canadian dollars.

title: 160 Demonstrators Are Arrested in U.S. For Salvador Sit-Ins
description: More than 160 demonstrators protesting United States involvement in El Salvador were arrested in New York and Washington yesterday.

title: Polish Leader in Kuwait
description: Poland's Prime Minister, Mieczyslaw Rakowski, arrived today for a three-day visit. He is expected to seek financial help from Kuwait for expansion of the Gdansk refinery.

title: Women Attacked at the Wailing Wall
description: A group of Jewish women trying to hold a prayer service at the Wailing Wall were attacked today by rigorously Orthodox men and forced to flee when the police fired tear gas to disperse the attackers.

title: Kevlin Microwave reports earnings for Qtr to Feb 28
description: b-Net loss Year-ago periods included a $180,000 writeoff of obsolete inventory.

title: Communications & Cable Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Net loss Latest quarter included a pretax gain of $15,027,000 from the sale of the company's Florida cable television operation, which was partially offset by operating losses from the company's Imnet Corp. Document Image Processing unit, acquired on Dec. 16.

title: KEY RATES
Long-Term Forest Studies Offer Insight Into Effect of Pollutants
description: IN the longest continuous study of the chemistry of a forest in the United States, scientists have been carefully monitoring an experimental forest here in the White Mountains since 1963 to learn about growth patterns and how they are affected by different conditions, like pollution.

title: INSIDE
description: Shuttle Sale Reopened Donald Trump, who agreed to buy Eastern Airlines' shuttle for $365 million, wants the price cut by at least $125 million. Eastern said it would seek other buyers. Page D1. Clashing Views of North The prosecution and the defense painted clashing views of Oliver L. North: a liar or a patriot who misled Congress to keep politicians from revealing national secrets. Page B6. Ban of Insecticide Urged Federal scientists recommend barring the use of an acutely toxic insecticide on potatoes and imported bananas, saying it is an unreasonable risk to children. Page A16. Driftnets: Harvest of Fear Fishing in the North Pacific, using giant nets that drift for miles, has aroused United States officials' concern. Opponents call the harvest ''strip mining.'' Page C1. Baseball Investigating Rose The baseball commissioner's office said it was investigating Pete Rose, the Cincinnati Reds' manager, who has been linked recently to gambling activities. Page B9.

title: Dr. Koop's Abortion Advice
description: Surgeon General C. Everett Koop might welcome evidence that abortions are harmful to women who have them. But much to his credit, he puts professional integrity ahead of political ideology. He therefore recently reiterated to a Congressional committee his belief that there are not enough data to support that conclusion.

title: Jane P. Schirber, 91, Retired Social Worker
description: Jane Packard Schirber, a retired social worker and former president of the New Jersey Council of Social Workers, died of pneumonia Saturday at the Princeton (N.J.) Medical Center. She was 91 years old and since 1976 had been a resident at the Presbyterian Home in Hightstown, N.J.

title: Circle K Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-After a net gain of $14,437,000 from the sale of the company's Phoenix commissary. The company said the commissary sale and last October's sale of its ice plants for a net gain of $6,409,000 are part of Circle K's plan to divest non-store assets. c-After a gain of $5.5 million from an accounting change. The company said last December, Circle K received $55,500,000 as the result of monetizing the royalty stream from its Japanese operation. Proceeds from these transactions were applied to debt reduction. Corrected from Friday, March 17.

title: Nutrition Therapy, New to AIDS Patients, Raises Ethical Issues
description: WITH some trepidation, a rapidly increasing number of AIDS patients are turning to a nutritional therapy intended to add weight to people who are wasting away.

title: First Murder, Then Rage, on a Quiet Long Island Street
description: First murder, then rising fury and resentment have disturbed the peace of Horton Road.

title: Israeli Intelligence Report Links Peace Hopes to Talks With P.L.O.
description: An internal intelligence agency report concludes that the Palestinian uprising cannot be brought to an end in the near future and that the Government will find a political solution only if it agrees to talk with the Palestine Liberation Organization, reports here said today.

title: Corrections
description: A review in the Peripherals column of Science Times on March 7 about the HeadStart III computer system from Vendex Technologies referred incorrectly to a copying ability of the MS-DOS operating system from MicroSoft Inc. In some cases it can make copies of files from a disk of one size to a disk of another. A further explanation appears today in the column, on page C5.

title: Gun Valley Tries to Adapt To the Winds Of Change
description: Since the modern system of manufacturing firearms was invented along the Connecticut River Valley in the 1800's and Gun Valley was given its name and enduring image, the fortunes of gun makers have risen and fallen through the violence of the American frontier and the tides of war and peace.

title: Ex-Haas Head Indicted On Securities Violations
description: The former chairman of a brokerage firm that collapsed after the market crash in October 1987 was indicted yesterday on charges of participating in a scheme to manipulate the prices of three stocks in the over-the-counter market.

title: Peel Me a Poison Grape
description: Have Americans become sissies? I didn't used to think so, but now I'm not so sure.

title: Groupe Transat reports earnings for Year to Oct 31
description: b-Net loss Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: In the World of the Organized Jewish Community, Money Talks
description: To the Editor:
